title: Use of SEM/FIB and Machine Learning to Characterize REBCO Conductors
content: REBCO conductor, composed of rare earth elements (RE), barium (Ba), copper (Cu), and oxygen (O), stands out as a leading candidate among high-temperature superconductors (HTS) for the development of next-generation high-field magnets. Its exceptional ability to carry high currents in magnetic fields, along with its mechanical resilience, positions it as a promising solution for advanced magnet applications. The REBCO conductors exhibit superconductivity at significantly higher temperatures than conventional low-temperature superconductors [1-3]. In this present study, we characterize and explore the microscale defects layer thickness on a commercial REBCO-coated conductor and correlate it with the in-field transport critical current (Ic) at a fixed orientation and critical current density (Jc) calculated using the equation:
